titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C14

body.ab: <milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0091__Pt2__main__1"/> We passed a few sad hours untill eleven <lb n="c56-0091__Pt2__main__2"/> o'clock when the trial was to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19864"/>begin<del eID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19864"/>commence<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19871"/>and<del eID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19871"/><mdel>m</mdel>My father <lb n="c56-0091__Pt2__main__3"/> and E<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19890"/>father<del eID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19890"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19893"/>El<del eID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19893"/> the rest of the family being obliged <lb n="c56-0091__Pt2__main__4"/> to attend as witnesses <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19899"/>Iac<del eID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19899"/> I accompanied them to <lb n="c56-0091__Pt2__main__5"/> the court. During the whole of this wretched <lb n="c56-0091__Pt2__main__6"/> mockery of justice I sufferred living torture.<lb n="c56-0091__Pt2__main__7"/> It was to be decided whether the result of <lb n="c56-0091__Pt2__main__8"/> my curiosity and lawless<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19922"/>desires<del eID="c56-0091__Pt2__main__d2e19922"/>devices would cause<lb n="c56-0092__main__1"/> the death of two of my fellow beings. One a <lb n="c56-0092__main__2"/> smiling babe full of innocence and joy, the <lb n="c56-0092__main__3"/> other far more dreadfully murdered with <lb n="c56-0092__main__4"/> every agravation <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e19945"/>ignominy<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e19945"/> infamy that could <lb n="c56-0092__main__5"/> make that murder <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e19953"/>more terrible<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e19953"/><mdel>.</mdel>memorable in horror. Justine <lb n="c56-0092__main__6"/> also was a girl of merit and possessed <lb n="c56-0092__main__7"/> qualities which promised to render her <lb n="c56-0092__main__8"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e19971"/>little world<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e19971"/>life happy; now all was to be oblite<lb n="c56-0092__main__9"/>rated in an<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e19985"/>d<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e19985"/> ignominious grave <mdel>–</mdel>; And I the <lb n="c56-0092__main__10"/> cause! A thousand times rather would <lb n="c56-0092__main__11"/> I have confessed myself guilty of the crime <lb n="c56-0092__main__12"/> ascribed to Justine, but I was absent when <lb n="c56-0092__main__13"/> it was committed and such a declaration <lb n="c56-0092__main__14"/> would havebeen considered as the ravings of <lb n="c56-0092__main__15"/> a madman and could not have excul<lb n="c56-0092__main__16"/>pated her who suffered through me.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0092__main__17"/> The <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e20024"/>aff<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e20024"/> appearance of Justine was <lb n="c56-0092__main__18"/> calm. She was dressed in <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e20030"/>morn<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e20030"/> mourning and <lb n="c56-0092__main__19"/> her countenance, always engaging, was rendered <lb n="c56-0092__main__20"/> by the solemnity of her feelings exquisite <lb n="c56-0092__main__21"/> -ly beautiful. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e20039"/>Yet she<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e20039"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e20043"/>Her mann<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e20043"/> Yet she <lb n="c56-0092__main__22"/> appeared confident in innocence and <lb n="c56-0092__main__23"/> did not tremble although gazed at and <lb n="c56-0092__main__24"/> execrated by thousands. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0092__main__d2e20052"/>fo<del eID="c56-0092__main__d2e20052"/> For all the kind <lb n="c56-0092__main__25"/> ness which her beauty might have <lb n="c56-0092__main__26"/> gained from others was obliterated by <lb n="c56-0092__main__27"/> the rememberance of the enormity she was <lb n="c56-0092__main__28"/> supposed to have committed. She was <lb n="c56-0092__main__29"/> tranquil yet her tranquillity was evident<lb n="c56-0093__main__1"/> constrained – and as her confusion had <lb n="c56-0093__main__2"/> before been adduced as a proof of her guilt <lb n="c56-0093__main__3"/> she worked <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20081"/>herself<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20081"/> up her mind to an appear<lb n="c56-0093__main__4"/>ance of courage. When she entered the court <lb n="c56-0093__main__5"/> she threw her eyes round it and quickly dis<lb n="c56-0093__main__6"/>covered where we were seated – a tear seemed <lb n="c56-0093__main__7"/> to dim her eye when she saw us but she <lb n="c56-0093__main__8"/> recovered herself and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20104"/>g<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20104"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20107"/>with<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20107"/> a look<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20110"/>e<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20110"/> of sorrow<lb n="c56-0093__main__9"/>ful affection seemed to attest her utter <lb n="c56-0093__main__10"/> guiltlessness.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0093__main__11"/> The trial began <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20126"/>and<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20126"/>listened attentive<lb n="c56-0093__main__12"/>ly wish and after the advocate against her <lb n="c56-0093__main__13"/> had stated the charge several witnesses <lb n="c56-0093__main__14"/> were called. Several strange facts combined <lb n="c56-0093__main__15"/> against her which would have staggered <lb n="c56-0093__main__16"/> any one who had not such prof of her <lb n="c56-0093__main__17"/> innocence as I had. She had been out the <lb n="c56-0093__main__18"/> whole of the night on which the mur<lb n="c56-0093__main__19"/>der had been committed and towards <lb n="c56-0093__main__20"/> morning had been perceived by a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20162"/>farme<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20162"/><lb n="c56-0093__main__21"/><lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__1"/>market-woman not far from the spot where <lb n="c56-0093__main__22"/> the body of the murdered child had been <lb n="c56-0093__main__23"/> afterwards found. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20184"/>He asked her wh<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20184"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20189"/>She<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20189"/>The woman<lb n="c56-0093__main__24"/> asked <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>her what she did there?–<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20216"/>for<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20216"/>but she looked <lb n="c56-0093__main__25"/> very <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20225"/>stang<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20225"/> strangely and only returned a <lb n="c56-0093__main__26"/> confused <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0093.04">^</metamark><lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__1"/>&unin<lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__2"/>telligible<lb n="c56-0093__left_margin__3"/><metamark function="displacement">^</metamark> answer<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20258"/>e<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20258"/>. <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><mdel>S</mdel>She<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20276"/>came<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20276"/> returned to <lb n="c56-0093__main__27"/> the house about eight o'clock and when <lb n="c56-0093__main__28"/> some one enquired where she had <lb n="c56-0093__main__29"/> passed the night she replied that she <lb n="c56-0093__main__30"/> had been looking <mdel>of</mdel>for the child and <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0093__main__d2e20305"/>enquired<del eID="c56-0093__main__d2e20305"/>demanded<lb n="c56-0093__main__31"/> earnestly if any thing had been heard con<lb n="c56-0093__main__32"/>cerning him. When the body was brought<lb n="c56-0094__main__1"/> into the house she fell into violent hys<lb n="c56-0094__main__2"/>terics and kept her bed for several <lb n="c56-0094__main__3"/> days. The picture was then produced <lb n="c56-0094__main__4"/> which the servant had found in her <lb n="c56-0094__main__5"/> pocket and when Elizabeth in a falte<lb n="c56-0094__main__6"/>ring voice proved that it was the same <lb n="c56-0094__main__7"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0094__main__d2e20355"/>she had<del eID="c56-0094__main__d2e20355"/>which<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0094__main__d2e20362"/>the<del eID="c56-0094__main__d2e20362"/> an hour before <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0094__main__d2e20365"/>the murder<del eID="c56-0094__main__d2e20365"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__8"/> the child had been missed,she had placed round <lb n="c56-0094__main__9"/> his neck a murmur of indignation <lb n="c56-0094__main__10"/> and horror filled the court.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__11"/> Justine was then called on for <lb n="c56-0094__main__12"/> her defence. God kno who reads all <lb n="c56-0094__main__13"/> hearts knows how As the trial had <lb n="c56-0094__main__14"/> proceeded her countenance had altered. <lb n="c56-0094__main__15"/> Surprise horror and misery were strong <lb n="c56-0094__main__16"/> ly expressed. Sometimes she struggled <lb n="c56-0094__main__17"/> with her tears <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0094__main__d2e20399"/>wh<del eID="c56-0094__main__d2e20399"/> but when she <lb n="c56-0094__main__18"/> was desired to speak she collected her <lb n="c56-0094__main__19"/> powers and spoke in an audible although <lb n="c56-0094__main__20"/> variable voice.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0094__main__21"/> "God knows," she said, "<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0094__main__d2e20413"/>w<del eID="c56-0094__main__d2e20413"/>how entirely I <lb n="c56-0094__main__22"/> am inocent. but I do not pretend to be <lb n="c56-0094__main__23"/> acquitted on account of my protestations <lb n="c56-0094__main__24"/> I rest my innocence <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0094__main__d2e20426"/>a<del eID="c56-0094__main__d2e20426"/> on a simple <lb n="c56-0094__main__25"/> explanation of the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0094__main__d2e20434"/>facts<del eID="c56-0094__main__d2e20434"/>facts which have <lb n="c56-0094__main__26"/> been adduced against me, and I hope <lb n="c56-0094__main__27"/> the character I have always borne will <lb n="c56-0094__main__28"/> encline my judges to a favourable <lb n="c56-0094__main__29"/> interpretation where any <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0094__main__d2e20451"/>fact<del eID="c56-0094__main__d2e20451"/>circumstance appears<lb n="c56-0095__main__1"/> doubtful or suspicious.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__2"/> By the permission of Mad<shi rend="sup"> e</shi> Lavenza <lb n="c56-0095__main__3"/> I passed the evening with an aunt at <lb n="c56-0095__main__4"/> Chêne. One of my cousins returning from <lb n="c56-0095__main__5"/> Geneva said that he had been at the <lb n="c56-0095__main__6"/> house of M. Frankenstein and<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__7"/> She then related that by the <lb n="c56-0095__main__8"/> permission of Elizabeth she had passed <lb n="c56-0095__main__9"/> the evening of the night on which the <lb n="c56-0095__main__10"/> murder was perpetrated at <mdel>M</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the house of an aunt <lb n="c56-0095__main__11"/> who resided in Chêne a village about <lb n="c56-0095__main__12"/> a league from Geneva. On her return <lb n="c56-0095__main__13"/>at about nine o'clock she met a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0095__main__d2e20532"/>servant<del eID="c56-0095__main__d2e20532"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__14"/> man who asked her if she had seen <lb n="c56-0095__main__15"/> any thing of the child who was lost. She <lb n="c56-0095__main__16"/> was frightened at this account, and passed <lb n="c56-0095__main__17"/> several hours in looking for him when <lb n="c56-0095__main__18"/> the gates of Geneva were shut and she <lb n="c56-0095__main__19"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0095__main__d2e20554"/>passed<del eID="c56-0095__main__d2e20554"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>was forced to remain<mdel>ed</mdel> s<shi rend="underline">e</shi>veral hours of the nightin a <lb n="c56-0095__main__20"/> cottage, but unable to rest or sleep, she <lb n="c56-0095__main__21"/> rose early that she might again <lb n="c56-0095__main__22"/> endeavour to find my brother. If she <lb n="c56-0095__main__23"/> had gone near the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0095__main__d2e20596"/><del eID="c56-0095__main__d2e20596"/> spot<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0095__main__d2e20601"/>e<del eID="c56-0095__main__d2e20601"/> where his <lb n="c56-0095__main__24"/> body lay it was without her knowledge <lb n="c56-0095__main__25"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0095__main__d2e20610"/>and she had been confused<del eID="c56-0095__main__d2e20610"/>That if she had been bewildered when ques <lb n="c56-0095__main__26"/> tioned by the market woman, was <lb n="c56-0095__main__27"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0095__main__d2e20624"/>that<del eID="c56-0095__main__d2e20624"/>not surprising when she <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0095__main__d2e20631"/>was so<del eID="c56-0095__main__d2e20631"/><lb n="c56-0095__main__28"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0095__main__d2e20636"/>c<del eID="c56-0095__main__d2e20636"/> was so wretched <mdel>on</mdel>for the loss of poor <lb n="c56-0095__main__29"/> William. Concerning the picture she <lb n="c56-0095__main__30"/> could give no account. "I know," continued<lb n="c56-0096__main__1"/> the unhappy victim<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20663"/>e<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20663"/> "how heavily and fatally this <lb n="c56-0096__main__2"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20668"/>o<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20668"/> one circumstance <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20671"/>we<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20671"/> weighs against me <lb n="c56-0096__main__3"/> but I have no power of explaining it and <lb n="c56-0096__main__4"/> when I have expressed my utter ignorance <lb n="c56-0096__main__5"/> I am only left <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20681"/>w<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20681"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20684"/>as any other is to conject<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20684"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20687"/>ure<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20687"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__6"/> to conjecture concerning the probabilities <lb n="c56-0096__main__7"/> by which it might have been placed in <lb n="c56-0096__main__8"/> my pocket. But <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20697"/>I<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20697"/> here also I am <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20702"/>at a<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20702"/>checked<lb n="c56-0096__main__9"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20714"/>stand<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20714"/>I believe that I have have no enemy on earth who <lb n="c56-0096__main__10"/> that I know and none surely who could have <lb n="c56-0096__main__11"/> been so wicked as <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20729"/>d<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20729"/> to destroy me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20735"/>so cruelly<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20735"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>wantonly.<lb n="c56-0096__main__12"/> Did the murderer place it there? I know <lb n="c56-0096__main__13"/> of no opportunity afforded him for so doing <lb n="c56-0096__main__14"/> or if I had why should he have stolen <lb n="c56-0096__main__15"/> the jewel to part with it <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>again so soon <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20771"/>again<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20771"/>?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__16"/> "I commit my cause to the justice of <lb n="c56-0096__main__17"/> my judges yet I see no room for hope. I <lb n="c56-0096__main__18"/> beg permission to have a few witnesses exam<lb n="c56-0096__main__19"/>ined concerning my character and if the<mdel>n</mdel>ir<lb n="c56-0096__main__20"/>testimony shall not overweighmy supposed guilt<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20807"/>is an apparent<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20807"/> I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20813"/>shall<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20813"/>must<lb n="c56-0096__main__21"/> be condemned although I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20822"/>p<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20822"/> would pledge <lb n="c56-0096__main__22"/> my salvation on my innocence."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0096__main__23"/> Several witnesses were called who had <lb n="c56-0096__main__24"/> known her for many years and they spoke <lb n="c56-0096__main__25"/> well of her but fear and hatred of the <lb n="c56-0096__main__26"/> crime of which they supposed her guilty <lb n="c56-0096__main__27"/> rendered them timorous and unwilling <lb n="c56-0096__main__28"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20844"/>to speak<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20844"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0096__main__d2e20853"/>come forward<del eID="c56-0096__main__d2e20853"/>. Elizabeth saw even this last <lb n="c56-0096__main__29"/> resource, her excellent and irreproacha<lb n="c56-0096__main__30"/>ble dispositions & conduct, about to fail<lb n="c56-0097__main__1"/> the accused, when although <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e20881"/>uncalled<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e20881"/><lb n="c56-0097__left_margin__1"/> violently <lb n="c56-0097__left_margin__2"/> agitated<lb n="c56-0097__main__2"/> she desired permission to speak. "I am" <lb n="c56-0097__main__3"/> said she "the cousin of the unhappy <lb n="c56-0097__main__4"/> child who was murdered or rather his <lb n="c56-0097__main__5"/> sister for I was educated <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>by and lived <lb n="c56-0097__main__6"/> with his parents <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e20921"/>s<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e20921"/> ever <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e20924"/>sin<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e20924"/> since and <lb n="c56-0097__main__7"/> long before his birth; it may therefore <lb n="c56-0097__main__8"/> be judged indecent in me to come <lb n="c56-0097__main__9"/> forward on this occasion but when <lb n="c56-0097__main__10"/> I see a fellow creature about to perish <lb n="c56-0097__main__11"/> through the cowardice of her pretended <lb n="c56-0097__main__12"/> friends I wish to be allowed to speak that <lb n="c56-0097__main__13"/> I may say what I know of her character. <lb n="c56-0097__main__14"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e20948"/>and<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e20948"/> I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e20953"/>know a great deal<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e20953"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>am well acquainted with it.<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e20966"/>for<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e20966"/> I have <lb n="c56-0097__main__15"/> lived in the same house with her at <lb n="c56-0097__main__16"/> one time for five and afterwards for <lb n="c56-0097__main__17"/> nearly two years. During all that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e20978"/>time<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e20978"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>period<lb n="c56-0097__main__18"/> she <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e20993"/><del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e20993"/> appeared to me a most amiable <lb n="c56-0097__main__19"/> and benevolent creature. She nurst <lb n="c56-0097__main__20"/> my aunt in her last illness with the <lb n="c56-0097__main__21"/> greatest affection and care and after <lb n="c56-0097__main__22"/> terwards attended her <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>own mother during a <lb n="c56-0097__main__23"/> long & tedious illness <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e21021"/>w<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e21021"/> in a manner <lb n="c56-0097__main__24"/> that excited the admiration of all <lb n="c56-0097__main__25"/> who knew her. After which she again <lb n="c56-0097__main__26"/> lived in my uncle's house where she <lb n="c56-0097__main__27"/> was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e21035"/>always a favourite<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e21035"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>beloved by all the family. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e21048"/>Of the deceased<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e21048"/><lb n="c56-0097__main__28"/> she was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e21056"/>very<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e21056"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e21059"/>fond<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e21059"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>warmly attached to <mdel>of</mdel> the child who has been murdered and acted towards him <lb n="c56-0097__main__29"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e21077"/>in<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e21077"/> like a most affectionate Mother.<lb n="c56-0097__main__30"/> for my own part I do not hesitate to <lb n="c56-0097__main__31"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0097__main__d2e21088"/>s<del eID="c56-0097__main__d2e21088"/>ay that not withstanding <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>all the evidence<lb n="c56-0098__main__1"/><lb n="c56-0098__left_margin__1"/>produced against her I believe and rely <mdel>i</mdel>on <lb n="c56-0098__main__2"/> her perfect innocence. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21135"/>An<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21135"/> She had <lb n="c56-0098__main__3"/> no<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21140"/>t<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21140"/> temptation <del next="#c56-0098.03" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21146"/>and her dispo character<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21146"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21151"/>whi<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21151"/> for such an action<lb n="c56-0098__main__4"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21158" xml:id="c56-0098.03"/>is amiable<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21158"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21161"/>for<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21161"/> as to the bauble on which <lb n="c56-0098__main__5"/> the chief proof rests <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21168"/>If<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21168"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21171"/>s<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21171"/><mdel>I</mdel><mdel/> if <shi rend="underline">s</shi>he had <lb n="c56-0098__main__6"/> earnestly wished for it I should have <lb n="c56-0098__main__7"/> willingly given it her so much <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21197"/>did<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21197"/> do <lb n="c56-0098__main__8"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21203"/>I rely<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21203"/> I esteem and value her."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0098__main__9"/> Excellent Elizabeth! A murmur <lb n="c56-0098__main__10"/> of approbation <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21212"/>o<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21212"/> was heard, but it <lb n="c56-0098__main__11"/> was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21220"/>on her account<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21220"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>excited by her generous interference& not in favour <lb n="c56-0098__main__12"/> of poor Justine on whom the public <lb n="c56-0098__main__13"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21237"/>ig<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21237"/> indignationwas turned with renewed <lb n="c56-0098__main__14"/> violence, charging herwith the blackest in- <lb n="c56-0098__main__15"/> gratitude. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21251"/>For<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21251"/> She herself wept as <lb n="c56-0098__main__16"/> Elizabeth spoke but she did not <lb n="c56-0098__main__17"/> answer. My own agitation<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>& anguish was extreme <lb n="c56-0098__main__18"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0098__main__d2e21273"/>wh<del eID="c56-0098__main__d2e21273"/> during the whole of the trial. The <lb n="c56-0098__main__19"/> picture was I believed in her inno<lb n="c56-0098__main__20"/>cence I knew it. Could the monster <lb n="c56-0098__main__21"/> who had (I did not for a minute <lb n="c56-0098__main__22"/> doubt) murdered my brother, alo in <lb n="c56-0098__main__23"/> his hellish sporthave betrayed the inno<lb n="c56-0098__main__24"/>cent to death and ignominy. I could <lb n="c56-0098__main__25"/> not sustain the horror of my situa <lb n="c56-0098__main__26"/> tion and when I saw that the popu<lb n="c56-0098__main__27"/>lar voice and the countenance of the<lb n="c56-0099__main__1"/> Judges had already condemned <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0099.01">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__1"/>the accu<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__2"/>sed<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__3"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark>my un<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__4"/>happy<lb n="c56-0099__left_margin__5"/> victim<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0099__main__d2e21371"/>her<del eID="c56-0099__main__d2e21371"/><lb n="c56-0099__main__2"/> I rushed out of the court in agony. The <lb n="c56-0099__main__3"/> tortures of the accused did not equal <lb n="c56-0099__main__4"/> mine she was sustained by innocence <lb n="c56-0099__main__5"/> but the fangs of remorse tore my bosom– <lb n="c56-0099__main__6"/> I passed a night of unmingled wretched<lb n="c56-0099__main__7"/>ness. In the morning I went to the <lb n="c56-0099__main__8"/> court; my lips and throat were <lb n="c56-0099__main__9"/> parched. I dared not ask the fatal <lb n="c56-0099__main__10"/> question – but I was known and the <lb n="c56-0099__main__11"/> officer guessed <del next="#c56-0099.05" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0099__main__d2e21407"/>what I came to en-<del eID="c56-0099__main__d2e21407"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the cause of my visit<lb n="c56-0099__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0099__main__d2e21422" xml:id="c56-0099.05"/>quire;<del eID="c56-0099__main__d2e21422"/> — the ballots had been thrown <lb n="c56-0099__main__13"/> they were all <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0099__main__d2e21432"/>blak<del eID="c56-0099__main__d2e21432"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>black& Justine was <lb n="c56-0099__main__14"/> condemned.<lb n="c56-0100__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0100.01" unit="tei:head"/>Chapter 1<mdel>1</mdel>2<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__2"/> I cannot attempt to describe what I <lb n="c56-0100__main__3"/> then felt – I had <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21479"/>had<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21479"/>experienced sensations of horror <lb n="c56-0100__main__4"/> before and I have endeavoured to bestow <lb n="c56-0100__main__5"/> on them adequate expressions but now <lb n="c56-0100__main__6"/> words cannot convey any idea of the <lb n="c56-0100__main__7"/> heart sickening despair that I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21497"/>then felt<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21497"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>endured. <lb n="c56-0100__main__8"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21512"/>Nor<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21512"/> The person to whom I had addressed <lb n="c56-0100__main__9"/> myself also added that Justine had al<lb n="c56-0100__main__10"/>ready confessed her guilt. "That evidence" he <lb n="c56-0100__main__11"/> observed –"was hardly required in so glaring <lb n="c56-0100__main__12"/> a case but I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21528"/>I<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21528"/> am glad of it; and indeed <lb n="c56-0100__main__13"/> none of our judges like to condemn a <lb n="c56-0100__main__14"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21536"/>ch<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21536"/> criminal upon circumstantial evi<lb n="c56-0100__main__15"/>dence<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21545"/>let it<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21545"/> be<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it ever so decisive."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__16"/> When I returned home Elizabeth <lb n="c56-0100__main__17"/> eagerly <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21569"/>enquired<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21569"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>demanded the result. "My cousin" <lb n="c56-0100__main__18"/> replied I, "it is decided as you may have <lb n="c56-0100__main__19"/> suspected – <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>allJudges had rather that ten <lb n="c56-0100__main__20"/> innocent should suffer tha<mdel>t</mdel>n that <lb n="c56-0100__main__21"/> one guilty should escape: but she <lb n="c56-0100__main__22"/> has confessed."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0100__main__23"/> This was a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21616"/>b<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21616"/> dire blow to poor Eliza<lb n="c56-0100__main__24"/>beth who had relied with firmness on <lb n="c56-0100__main__25"/> her innocence. "Alas!" said she "How <lb n="c56-0100__main__26"/> shall I ever again believe in human <lb n="c56-0100__main__27"/> benovolence – Justine, whom I loved and <lb n="c56-0100__main__28"/> esteemed as my sister. How could she <lb n="c56-0100__main__29"/> put on <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0100__main__d2e21637"/>thos<del eID="c56-0100__main__d2e21637"/> those smiles of innocence <lb n="c56-0100__main__30"/> only to betray– her mild eyes seemed inca<lb n="c56-0101__main__1"/>pable of any severity or ill humour and <lb n="c56-0101__main__2"/> yet she has <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0101__main__d2e21658"/>com<del eID="c56-0101__main__d2e21658"/> committed a murder."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__3"/> Soon after we heard that the <lb n="c56-0101__main__4"/> poor victim had expressed a wish to <lb n="c56-0101__main__5"/> see my cousin. My father wished her not <lb n="c56-0101__main__6"/> to go but said that he left it to her <lb n="c56-0101__main__7"/> own judgement and feelings to decide. <lb n="c56-0101__main__8"/> "Yes," said Elizabeth "I will go although <lb n="c56-0101__main__9"/> she is guilty – and you Victor shall acco<lb n="c56-0101__main__10"/>pany me –I cannot go alone". <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0101__main__d2e21685"/>This<del eID="c56-0101__main__d2e21685"/> The <lb n="c56-0101__main__11"/> idea of this visit was torture to me <lb n="c56-0101__main__12"/> yet I could not refuse.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__13"/> We entered the gloomy prison cham<lb n="c56-0101__main__14"/>ber and beheld Justine sitting on some <lb n="c56-0101__main__15"/> straw at the further end; her hands <lb n="c56-0101__main__16"/> were mannacled and her head rested <lb n="c56-0101__main__17"/> on her <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0101__main__d2e21710"/>knews<del eID="c56-0101__main__d2e21710"/> knees,– she rose on seeing <lb n="c56-0101__main__18"/> us and when <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0101__main__d2e21715"/>th<del eID="c56-0101__main__d2e21715"/> we were left alone <lb n="c56-0101__main__19"/> with her she threw herself at the <lb n="c56-0101__main__20"/> feet of Elizabeth weeping bitterly.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__21"/> My cousin wept also – Oh Justine <lb n="c56-0101__main__22"/> said she, why did you rob me of my <lb n="c56-0101__main__23"/> last consolation – I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0101__main__d2e21734"/>believed<del eID="c56-0101__main__d2e21734"/>relied<mdel>i</mdel>on your <lb n="c56-0101__main__24"/> innocence and although I was very <lb n="c56-0101__main__25"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0101__main__d2e21754"/>wh<del eID="c56-0101__main__d2e21754"/> wretched I was not so miserable <lb n="c56-0101__main__26"/> as I am now."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__27"/> "And do you also believe that I am <lb n="c56-0101__main__28"/> so very very wicked–?<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>Cried Justine Do you also join <lb n="c56-0101__main__29"/> with my enemies to crush me? Her <lb n="c56-0101__main__30"/> voice was suffocated <mdel>in</mdel>with sobs.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0101__main__31"/> "Rise my poor girl," said Elizabeth <lb n="c56-0101__main__32"/> "why do you kneel if you are innocent<lb n="c56-0102__main__1"/> I am not one of your enemies, I believed in <lb n="c56-0102__main__2"/> your innocence notwithstanding every <lb n="c56-0102__main__3"/> evidence untill I heard that you had <lb n="c56-0102__main__4"/> yourself declared your guilt. That report <lb n="c56-0102__main__5"/> you say is false, and be assured my <lb n="c56-0102__main__6"/> dear Justine nothing can for a minute <lb n="c56-0102__main__7"/> shake my confidence in you but <lb n="c56-0102__main__8"/> your own confession–"<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0102__main__9"/> "I did confess" said Justine "but <lb n="c56-0102__main__10"/> I confessed a lie. I confessed that I <lb n="c56-0102__main__11"/> might obtain absolution but now <lb n="c56-0102__main__12"/> that falsehood lies heavier at my <lb n="c56-0102__main__13"/> heart than all my other sins. The God <lb n="c56-0102__main__14"/> of heaven forgive me! Ever since I <lb n="c56-0102__main__15"/> was condemned my confessor has besieged <lb n="c56-0102__main__16"/> me,– he threatened and menaced untill <lb n="c56-0102__main__17"/> I almost began to think that I was <lb n="c56-0102__main__18"/> the wicked wretch he said I was. He <lb n="c56-0102__main__19"/> threatened excomunication and Hell <lb n="c56-0102__main__20"/> fire in my last moments if I con<lb n="c56-0102__main__21"/>tinued obdurate. Dear Lady, I had none <lb n="c56-0102__main__22"/> to support me – all looked on me <lb n="c56-0102__main__23"/> as a wretch doom to ignominy and <lb n="c56-0102__main__24"/> perdition; what could I do? In an evil <lb n="c56-0102__main__25"/> hour I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0102__main__d2e21873"/>confessed<del eID="c56-0102__main__d2e21873"/> subscribed to a lie <lb n="c56-0102__main__26"/> and now only I am truly miserable." She <lb n="c56-0102__main__27"/> paused, weeping, and then continued. <lb n="c56-0102__main__28"/> "I thought with horror, my sweet lady, <lb n="c56-0102__main__29"/> that you should <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0102__main__d2e21885"/>sho<del eID="c56-0102__main__d2e21885"/> believe that<lb n="c56-0103__main__1"/> your Justine whom your bessed <lb n="c56-0103__main__2"/> aunt had so highly honoured and <lb n="c56-0103__main__3"/> whom you loved, was a wretch capa<lb n="c56-0103__main__4"/>ble of<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a crime which <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0103__main__d2e21923"/>not<del eID="c56-0103__main__d2e21923"/>none but the <lb n="c56-0103__main__5"/> devil himself <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0103__main__d2e21934"/>was capable of<del eID="c56-0103__main__d2e21934"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could have perpetrated. Dear <lb n="c56-0103__main__6"/> William, dearest blessed child, I soon <lb n="c56-0103__main__7"/> shall see you again in heaven &<lb n="c56-0103__main__8"/> glory and that consoles me going as <lb n="c56-0103__main__9"/> I am to suffer ignominy and de"ath.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__10"/> "Oh Justine" cried the weeping <lb n="c56-0103__main__11"/> Elizabeth, "forgive me for having for <lb n="c56-0103__main__12"/> one moment distrusted you – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0103__main__d2e21968"/>But<del eID="c56-0103__main__d2e21968"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__13"/> why didyou confess? But do not mourn <lb n="c56-0103__main__14"/> my dear girl, I will every where <lb n="c56-0103__main__15"/> proclaim your innocence and will <lb n="c56-0103__main__16"/> force belief. Yet you must die – <lb n="c56-0103__main__17"/> you my companion, my playfellow, <lb n="c56-0103__main__18"/> my more than sister— die –I never <lb n="c56-0103__main__19"/> never can survive so horrible <lb n="c56-0103__main__20"/> a misfortune".<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__21"/> "Dear Sweet lady," do not weep"– <lb n="c56-0103__main__22"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0103__main__d2e21998"/>sai<del eID="c56-0103__main__d2e21998"/> replied Justine"– you ought to <lb n="c56-0103__main__23"/> raise me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0103__main__d2e22003"/>w<del eID="c56-0103__main__d2e22003"/> with thoughts of a better <lb n="c56-0103__main__24"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0103__main__d2e22011"/>world<del eID="c56-0103__main__d2e22011"/>life, and elevate me from the <lb n="c56-0103__main__25"/> petty cares of this world of injustice <lb n="c56-0103__main__26"/> and strife –Do not you, excellent <lb n="c56-0103__main__27"/> Elizabeth drive me to despair."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0103__main__28"/> Elizabeth <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0103__main__d2e22029"/>Em<del eID="c56-0103__main__d2e22029"/> embraced the suffer <lb n="c56-0103__main__29"/> er "I will try to comfort you," said she,<lb n="c56-0104__main__1"/> but this I fear is an evil too deep and poignant <lb n="c56-0104__main__2"/> to admit of consolation <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22052"/>or<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22052"/> for there is no hope <lb n="c56-0104__main__3"/> Yet heaven bless thee, my dearest Justine, <lb n="c56-0104__main__4"/> with resignation and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22062"/>a hope<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22062"/>a confidence elevated <lb n="c56-0104__main__5"/> beyond this world. Oh how I hate all its shews <lb n="c56-0104__main__6"/> and mockeries.– When one creature is <lb n="c56-0104__main__7"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22077"/>deprived of life<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22077"/>murdered<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22087"/>they<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22087"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22090"/>bel<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22090"/>another is immediately mur<lb n="c56-0104__main__8"/>der<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22108"/>another<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22108"/>deprive of life in a slow torturing <lb n="c56-0104__main__9"/> manner &<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>then the executioners their hands yet reeking with the blood of innocence believe that they have done <lb n="c56-0104__main__10"/>a great <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22151"/>things<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22151"/>deed. They call this retribution; hate<lb n="c56-0104__main__11"/>ful name! When that <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>word is pronounced <lb n="c56-0104__main__12"/> I know that greater and more horrid <lb n="c56-0104__main__13"/> punishments are going to be inflicted <lb n="c56-0104__main__14"/> than the gloomiest tyrant has <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>everin<lb n="c56-0104__main__15"/> ventented to satiatehis utmost revenge. Yet this <lb n="c56-0104__main__16"/> is not consolation <mdel>to</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>for you, my Justine, <lb n="c56-0104__main__17"/> unless indeed that you may glory <lb n="c56-0104__main__18"/> in escaping so miserable a den. Alas! <lb n="c56-0104__main__19"/> I would I were <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in peace with my aunt & my <lb n="c56-0104__main__20"/> sweet William – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22253"/>in peace<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22253"/> escaped <lb n="c56-0104__main__21"/> from light which <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22260"/>I abhor<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22260"/>is hateful to me and the <lb n="c56-0104__main__22"/> visages of men which are hateful to <lb n="c56-0104__main__23"/> me." I abhor.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0104__main__24"/> Justine smiled languidly. "This, dear Lady <lb n="c56-0104__main__25"/> said she is despair and not resignation. <lb n="c56-0104__main__26"/> I must not learn the lesson that you <lb n="c56-0104__main__27"/> would teach me – talk of somthing else <lb n="c56-0104__main__28"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22289"/>of fields<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22289"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22292"/>s<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22292"/> of something that will <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0104__main__d2e22295"/>brig jo<del eID="c56-0104__main__d2e22295"/><lb n="c56-0104__main__29"/> bring joy and not encrease of misery."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__1"/> During this conversation I had retired <lb n="c56-0105__main__2"/> to a corner of the prison-room where <lb n="c56-0105__main__3"/> I could conceal the horrid anguish <lb n="c56-0105__main__4"/> that possessed me– Despair! Who dared <lb n="c56-0105__main__5"/> talk of that? The poor victim who <lb n="c56-0105__main__6"/> on the morrow was to pass the <lb n="c56-0105__main__7"/> dreary boundary of life & death felt <lb n="c56-0105__main__8"/> not as I did — Such deep & bitter agony <lb n="c56-0105__main__9"/> I gnashed my teeth and ground them <lb n="c56-0105__main__10"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0105__main__d2e22337"/><del eID="c56-0105__main__d2e22337"/> together uttering a groan that came <lb n="c56-0105__main__11"/> from my inmost soul. Justine started <lb n="c56-0105__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0105__main__d2e22346"/>and<del eID="c56-0105__main__d2e22346"/> when she saw wh<mdel>a</mdel>o<mdel>t</mdel> it was <lb n="c56-0105__main__13"/> she approached me. "Dear Sir," said <lb n="c56-0105__main__14"/> she, "you are very kind to visit me; <lb n="c56-0105__main__15"/> you I hope do not believe that I am <lb n="c56-0105__main__16"/> guilty."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__17"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0105__main__d2e22375"/>"<del eID="c56-0105__main__d2e22375"/>I could not answer – "No Justine" <lb n="c56-0105__main__18"/> said Elizabeth; "he is <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0105__main__d2e22380"/>even<del eID="c56-0105__main__d2e22380"/> more <lb n="c56-0105__main__19"/> convinced of your innocence than <lb n="c56-0105__main__20"/> I was for even when he heard <lb n="c56-0105__main__21"/> that you had confessed he did not <lb n="c56-0105__main__22"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0105__main__d2e22394"/>believe<del eID="c56-0105__main__d2e22394"/>credit it."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0105__main__23"/> "I truly thank him"– said Justine <lb n="c56-0105__main__24"/> "In these last minutes I feel the <lb n="c56-0105__main__25"/> sincerest gratitude for those who <lb n="c56-0105__main__26"/> still think of me with kindness. How <lb n="c56-0105__main__27"/> sweet is the affection of others to <lb n="c56-0105__main__28"/> such a wretch as I am – It removes <lb n="c56-0105__main__29"/> more than half my misfortune <lb n="c56-0105__main__30"/> and I feel as if I could die in <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0105__main__d2e22429"/>pea<del eID="c56-0105__main__d2e22429"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__1"/> peace. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22442"/>thn<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22442"/> now that my innocence isacknow<lb n="c56-0106__main__2"/>ledged by you, sweet lady, and your cousin."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__3"/> Thus the poor sufferer <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22459"/>cr<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22459"/> tried <lb n="c56-0106__main__4"/> to comfort others and herself. She indeed <lb n="c56-0106__main__5"/> gained the resignation she wished for <lb n="c56-0106__main__6"/> but I the true murderer <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22469"/>w<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22469"/> felt <lb n="c56-0106__main__7"/> the never dying worm alive <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22476"/>and I was<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22476"/>which<lb n="c56-0106__main__8"/> allowed no hope or consolation. Eliza<lb n="c56-0106__main__9"/>beth also wept and was unhappy but <lb n="c56-0106__main__10"/> hers<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>also was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22506"/>also<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22506"/> the misery of innocence <lb n="c56-0106__main__11"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__left_margin__d2e22520"/>that<del eID="c56-0106__left_margin__d2e22520"/>which like a cloud <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22531"/>that<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22531"/>that passes over the <lb n="c56-0106__main__12"/> fair moon <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22542"/>which<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22542"/>& for a while <lb n="c56-0106__main__13"/>des but cannot <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22563"/>disturb<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22563"/>destroy its brightness <lb n="c56-0106__main__14"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22572"/>but<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22572"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22575"/>misery<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22575"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22578"/>&<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22578"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22581"/>desp<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22581"/> anguish and <lb n="c56-0106__main__15"/> despair had <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22587"/>penetr<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22587"/> penetrated into <lb n="c56-0106__main__16"/> the core of my heart – I bore a hell <lb n="c56-0106__main__17"/> within me that nothing could <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22596"/>diminish<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22596"/><mdel>.</mdel>extinguish.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0106__main__18"/> We staid several hours with Justine <lb n="c56-0106__main__19"/> and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0106__main__d2e22613"/>with<del eID="c56-0106__main__d2e22613"/> it was with great difficulty <lb n="c56-0106__main__20"/> that Elizabeth tore herself away <lb n="c56-0106__main__21"/> "I wish" cried she that I were to die <lb n="c56-0106__main__22"/> with you – I cannot live in th<mdel>e</mdel>is world <lb n="c56-0106__main__23"/> of misery." Justine assumed an air <lb n="c56-0106__main__24"/> of Cheerfullness whi<mdel>ch</mdel>le she with diffi<lb n="c56-0106__main__25"/>culty repressed the bitter tears – "Farewell <lb n="c56-0106__main__26"/> sweet lady, dearest Elizabeth may heaven <lb n="c56-0106__main__27"/> in its bounty bless and preserve you<lb n="c56-0107__main__1"/> May this be the last misfortune that <lb n="c56-0107__main__2"/> you will ever suffer. – live & be happy <lb n="c56-0107__main__3"/> to make <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22670"/>of<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22670"/> others so.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0107__main__4"/> As We returned Elizabeth said, You <lb n="c56-0107__main__5"/> do not know, my dear Victor, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22680"/>w<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22680"/> how <lb n="c56-0107__main__6"/> much I am relieved now that I trust <lb n="c56-0107__main__7"/> in the innocence of this unfortunate <lb n="c56-0107__main__8"/> girl. I never could again have <lb n="c56-0107__main__9"/> known peace if I had been deceived <lb n="c56-0107__main__10"/> in my reliance on her. For the mo<lb n="c56-0107__main__11"/>ment that I did believe it I felt <lb n="c56-0107__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22703"/>such<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22703"/> anguish that I could not have <lb n="c56-0107__main__13"/> long sustained. Now my heart is light<lb n="c56-0107__main__14"/>ened. The innocent suffers – but she <lb n="c56-0107__main__15"/> whom I thought amiable and good <lb n="c56-0107__main__16"/> is not wicked and I am consoled."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0107__main__17"/>Amiable<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22728"/>Sweet<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22728"/> Cousin! Such were your <lb n="c56-0107__main__18"/> thoughts mild and gentle as your <lb n="c56-0107__main__19"/> dear eyes <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22737"/>&<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22737"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22740"/>gentle tone<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22740"/> and voice.<lb n="c56-0107__main__20"/> but I.—— I was a wretch <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22748"/>none<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22748"/>&<lb n="c56-0107__main__21"/> none ever conceived <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22754"/>of<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22754"/> the misery <lb n="c56-0107__main__22"/> that I then suffered.
